intro: Cyanoseris perennis, commonly known as the blue everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has silver-gray foliage and produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Cyanoseris perennis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
